subject: Psychology
title: Appraisal Theory
description: A fast breakdown of Appraisal Theory for builders.

hook.text: Two students get a C on a test. One laughs it off. The other cries. Same event, different emotions.

buildup.text: Appraisal theory says emotions arise from how you evaluate an event, not from the event itself.

discovery.text: Lazarus proposed that appraisal â€” your personal assessment of relevance and coping ability â€” creates emotion.

twist.text: Change the appraisal and the emotion changes. A job rejection can feel devastating or liberating.

climax.text: This explains why the same event triggers different emotions in different people. Meaning is personal.

punchline.text: Events don't cause emotions. Your interpretation does.

quiz.question: What does appraisal theory emphasize as the cause of emotion?
options: Your personal evaluation of the event
The event itself regardless of interpretation
